attributes.action: To reinstate the metropolitan public carriage office, due to the failure of TFL
attributes.additional_details: The failure of TFL to regulate the amount of PHV licenses is bringing London to a standstill over 1000 licenses are being issue a week, which is also effecting the livelihood of all taxi drivers. Taxi and PHV are not the same, taxi are designed for public safety and regulated to Eu standards the driver is crb checked and invests in him or her self 2 - 4 years of training. The PHV can be any vehicle, drivers relie solely on an sat nav this in can be a safety hazard which the police have confirmed
attributes.background: The Iconic London taxi has served London for over 300 years, it is seen as the best in the world. Under the metropolitan police the public carriage office (PCO) kept a high standard of regulation. Since the closure of the PCO,  taxis and PHV'S licenses have been issued by Transport for London (TFL).

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the London Assembly. 

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: 

https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions
